content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a mutual consent divorce case between a husband and wife the parties have made agreements regarding the settlement of their assets including movable and immovable property as well as their debts and liabilities they have also agreed on matters related to their childrens custody and support the parties have waived certain rights and obligations such as maintenance payments and have declared that they no longer owe anything to each other these agreements will be effective once the divorce decree is signed and become final the costs of the divorce proceedings will be shared equally between the parties and if the proceedings are terminated due to one partys default the defaulting party will be responsible for the full costs the parties have also agreed on provisional binding contracts until the divorce is finalized they have chosen to submit their divorce petition to the family court and have been informed of their right to choose another notary or legal counsel if needed the notary has confirmed their identities and the accuracy of the information provided the document has been registered and the necessary fees have been paid
